HealthWalk is an application for mobile devices with Android OS. 
 It is developed by Alejandro Lopez Espinosa, Oscar Gonzalez Ossorio and Stoyan Veselinov Andreev for the subject Sistemas MÃ³viles of the Superior School of Computer Engineering in Valladolid, Spain.
 The app uses the google maps API in order to show the location of the user, and all of the nearby medical centers that surround the user in a specific radius measured in meters.
 The oldest API version with which the app functions is 16 (Android 4.1, 4.1.1 - Jelly Bean), and the target API version is the latest, 21 (Android 5.0 LOLLIPOP).
 It is implemented in Java, and three natural languages: English, Spanish and Bulgarian.
 The target audience of HealthWalk are people with medical emergencies or people who are not familiar with their surroundings and do not know where the nearest medical center is.

When you open HealthWalk the first thing you will see is your own location marked with a green color. The next things you will notice are all the medical centers in red, and the nearest one in blue.
 You can zoom in and out on the map whenever you like.
 When you choose a medical center you will be shown the name, address, city and telephone number of the center, along with two buttons, Route and Call.
 If you press Route the app will show you the fastest way to get there and the distance in between. If you press Call the app will automatically dial the medical center you have chosen.
 To access the preferences click on the preferences icon on the upper right corner and choose the option you wish to modify.
 Every optcion available for modification is explained clearly with a smaller text under the option name in the preferences menu.
 These options are divided in three groups for a better understanding: Updatings, Map and Route.
